summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Twenty-fourth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-fifth Street to West Seventy-fifth Street; and Twenty-fifth Avenue Northwest, from West Sixty-fifth Street to West Seventieth Street, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing sewers therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, manholes, lampholes, flush tanks, catch basins and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 1336 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
